title: U.S. Space Command declares ‘full operational capability’
summary: U.S. Space Command, the Defense Department’s combatant command responsible for space operations, has achieved full operational capability, its commander Gen. James Dickinson announced Dec. 15.

title: China launches large classified optical satellite towards geostationary orbit
summary: China sent the classified Yaogan-41 satellite towards geostationary orbit Friday using the country’s largest rocket.

title: Daily Telescope: One of the most stunning Andromeda photos I’ve ever seen
summary: The image is the result of 100 hours of observing.

title: Electron returns to flight with successful launch of Japanese radar imaging satellite
summary: Rocket Lab successfully launched a Japanese radar imaging satellite on the first flight of its Electron rocket since a failure nearly three months ago.

title: MaiaSpace Completes First Kick Stage Engine Test
summary:
ArianeGroup subsidiary MaiaSpace has announced the completion of the first hot fire test of the engine that will power the company’s Colibri kick stage. The kick stage will be encased in a three-meter-tall fairing and will allow the launch startup to offer greater flexibility to its customers. To date, ArianeGroup has injected close to €40 […]
The post MaiaSpace Completes First Kick Stage Engine Test appeared first on European Spaceflight.
